block.p: A SLIP IN TIME -- Some Democrats have been grumbling that the convention schedule has been very loose, but others see that as a virtue that has helped their ratings. PAGE A21
COURTING LIBERALS -- Senator Joseph I. Lieberman visited three important constituency groups yesterday, trying to firm up the support of the liberal wing of the party. PAGE A23
A SLIP IN TIME -- Some Democrats have been grumbling that the convention schedule has been very loose, but others see that as a virtue that has helped their ratings. PAGE A21
COURTING LIBERALS -- Senator Joseph I. Lieberman visited three important constituency groups yesterday, trying to firm up the support of the liberal wing of the party. PAGE A23
A POWER BROKER -- Representative Patrick J. Kennedy has achieved his stardom in the behind-the-scenes world of money and politics, raising millions for candidates. PAGE A21
A GRACIOUS HOST -- On the day that her son would be nominated for president, Pauline LaFon Gore found herself surrounded by family, friends and admirers. PAGE A25
